channel.title: What is DDos'ing
channel.description: I just wonder if anyone could explain good for me what it is to Ddos someone? I have heard people talk about it but didnt understand a shit about it :S Please explain it xD

item.title: What is DDos'ing

item.description:

[quote=“neroxx, post:24, topic:431646”][quote author=heatrn11 link=topic=534351.msg3908363#msg3908363 date=1328457171]

Anyone know how to Dos a website?

syn gui tool.
[/quote] Explain please… :P[/quote]

No, don’t explain actually. That’ll result in punishment. We don’t support such activities on this website, nor will we ever.

Read full topic

item.title: What is DDos'ing
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:20, topic:431646”]Anyone ever heard of a ‘sink attack’? A friend of mine who has his major in computer science said when you strip the return address from the TCP packet so that the server can’t send it to the correct address, it could cause issues.

en.wikipedia.org

Transmission Control Protocol

The Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) is one of the main protocols of the Internet protocol suite. It originated in the initial network implementation in which it complemented the Internet Protocol (IP). Therefore, the entire suite is commonly referred to as TCP/IP. TCP provides reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of a stream of octets (bytes) between applications running on hosts communicating via an IP network. Major Internet applications such as the World Wide Web, email, remote ad...

I’m not an expert at networking so I was curious to hear if anyone has ever heard of this before.[/quote]
lookup syn flooding

Read full topic

item.title: What is DDos'ing
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Anyone ever heard of a ‘sink attack’? A friend of mine who has his major in computer science said when you strip the return address from the TCP packet so that the server can’t send it to the correct address, it could cause issues.

en.wikipedia.org

Transmission Control Protocol

The Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) is one of the main protocols of the Internet protocol suite. It originated in the initial network implementation in which it complemented the Internet Protocol (IP). Therefore, the entire suite is commonly referred to as TCP/IP. TCP provides reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of a stream of octets (bytes) between applications running on hosts communicating via an IP network. Major Internet applications such as the World Wide Web, email, remote ad...

I’m not an expert at networking so I was curious to hear if anyone has ever heard of this before.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:14, topic:431646”][quote author=t4 link=topic=534351.msg3907668#msg3907668 date=1328393228]

I just wonder if anyone could explain good for me what it is to Ddos someone? I have heard people talk about it but didnt understand a shit about it :S Please explain it xD

its basically when you spam a server, (Distributed Denial of Service), and it gets confused or it shuts it self down, leaveing no outgoing packets. After that, the owner gets mindfucked.

are you trying to be funny or just stupid?
[/quote]

just trolling :p[/quote]

it didn’t even make sense???

Read full topic

item.title: What is DDos'ing
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:8, topic:431646”][quote author=vortex link=topic=534351.msg3906575#msg3906575 date=1328300366]
how to ddos

  1. get low orbit ion cannon
  2. choose target
  3. click ddos
  4. ???
  5. nothing happens
    [/quote]

LOIC is Dos and not DDos,
and OP asked “what” not “how”[/quote]

Tell buddy to use simultaneously.
Instant DDos.

Read full topic

item.title: What is DDos'ing
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“Pzezima2, post:9, topic:431646”]Go into CMD

ping someonesIP -t -l 25000

There.[/quote]

RandQm:

OP asked “what” not “how”

DDoSing is short for Distributed Denial of Service. A DDoS attack is performed by more than one user who more than likely has hundreds, if not thousands, of botnet slaves… Correct me if I’m wrong.
What this performed attack does is use so much of the bandwidth that the computer being attacked’s internet goes offline until the botnet master stops attacking the person’s IP.
To stop these attacks, when the event is detected, the server must redirect to swing the attack traffic to a DDoS Protection Services site before it can overwhelm or otherwise harm your network.

Read full topic

item.title: What is DDos'ing
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

nl.wikipedia.org

Distributed denial-of-service

Denial-of-service-aanvallen (DoS-aanvallen) en distributed denial-of-service-aanvallen (DDoS-aanvallen) zijn pogingen om een computer, computernetwerk of dienst niet of moeilijker bereikbaar te maken voor de bedoelde klanten. Het verschil tussen een 'gewone' DoS-aanval en een distributed DoS-aanval is dat in het laatste geval meerdere computers tegelijk de aanval op hun doelwit uitvoeren. Voor DDoS wordt vaak een botnet gebruikt, maar het kan ook gaan om meerdere personen die hun acties coördin...

edit: dutch ^
know what I mean fucking google it

Read full topic
